channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: TED Is Moving to San Diego—and It’s a True Playbook on Reinvention
item.description: TED Talks are coming back to California—not as a retreat, but as a recalibration.

item.title: Melinda French Gates Received Billions From an Old Flame
item.description: The gift went to Pivotal Ventures, her philanthropy expanding women’s influence.

item.title: These five ingenious materials from 2025 could make buildings greener
item.description: Construction materials are responsible for nearly one-third of global carbon dioxide emissions. And as global demand for construction continues to ris...

item.title: Gen Z could wave goodbye to résumés because most companies have turned to skills-based recruitment—and find it more effective, research shows
item.description: It might not be long until résumé are a thing of the past because most bosses are favoring skills-based hiring and reporting big results.

item.title: Why 2026 will be the year companies finally start to take worker well-being seriously
item.description: Throughout 2025, we’ve watched companies treat employees with a stunning disregard: rolling layoffs (with thousands let go at a time), unchecked workl...

item.title: AI Boosted My Productivity—Until It Didn’t
item.description: These are the AI tools I found useful every day—and the ways the technology is still failing to live up to its potential.

item.title: New York City finally joins London, Singapore and other world-class cities with a tap-only subway system
item.description: The Metrocard replaced the subway token in 1994, but now it's being phased out for tap-and-go, first introduced in 2019.

item.title: African millennials and Gen Z are quitting their big-city dreams to go make more money back on the farm

item.title: The weakest labor market since 2011 has BofA asking, ‘Dude, where’s my job?’
item.description: "A lack of recovery in the jobs market and a slower U.S. economy are key risks to watch for 2026."

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, 1960s French screen siren turned activist, dies at 91

item.title: A winter storm system with heavy snow and ‘dangerous wind chills’ is sweeping the U.S.
item.description: A potent winter storm threatened blizzard-like conditions, treacherous travel, and power outages in parts of the Upper Midwest as other areas of the c...

item.title: Every year, a billionaire CEO doles out $1,000 checks to local college grads—with a catch: They have to give half the money to charity
item.description: “The turmoil in our country has increased the need for caring, sharing and compassion,” Rob Hale said.

item.title: When Winter Isn’t the Only Thing Spiking
item.description: Readiness is the new HR superpower.

item.title: From CEO to Thought Leader
item.description: How to transition and gain influence in this new role
